m_primacy_kindness: Staying can be love. Staying can also be inertia.
You learned to treat presence as proof.
The lens kept choosing comfort over accuracy.
m_primacy_betrayal: You kept looking for the moment you could stop being surprised.
Anger protected you from wanting them again.
The lens turned every detail into evidence.
m_primacy_neglect: Waiting taught you what you were allowed to ask for.
You practiced needing less until it felt like personality.
The lens made absence feel inevitable.
m_primacy_intimacy: Tenderness can be true and still be costly.
The lens made closeness feel like destiny.
m_primacy_shame: Shame offered you simplicity: if it's all your fault, nothing is uncertain.
You searched for punishment because it would feel like resolution.
The lens tried to turn grief into verdict.
m_primacy_relief: You called it air because naming it would change you.
The lens made escape feel like clarity.

honesty: You let contradictions remain. You didn't force them to agree.
avoidance: You built a story you could carry. Weight matters.
You edited for survival. You called it clarity.
tenderness: You protected something soft, even when it complicated truth.
You refused to turn the past into a weapon.
anger: Anger kept the story from collapsing inward.
It gave you a spine, even when it narrowed your vision.
shame: Shame tried to make the ending simple.
You kept searching for a clean punishment to replace grief.

present: You felt the urge to set things aside. Later became never.
The story stayed coherent. The cost showed up elsewhere.
absent: You didn't force the past to behave.
You let the messy parts stay in the room.

low: You moved slowly enough to notice what you were doing.
mid: You started answering faster than you were feeling.
You could sense the story tightening.
high: Memory started acting like a threat.
The mind protected itself by breaking the narrative into pieces.
